text: so here we are we are just seconds away
from the result of the exit poll our
first prediction of the potential
outcome of this election more than
20,000 people were asked how they voted
today at a hundred and forty-four
polling stations right across the UK on
behalf of the BBC ITV and Sky so as Big
Ben reaches 10 o'clock we are standing
by with those crucial exit poll figures
here they are
our exit poll is suggesting that there
will be a conservative majority when all
the votes are counted after this
election of December 2019 the
Conservatives on three hundred and sixty
eight seats and labour way down on a
hundred and ninety-one now on those
figures we are looking at a conservative
majority of 86 if the votes actually
tally up with this prediction and that
will be the biggest conservative
majority since Margaret Thatcher's third
victory back in 1987 let's look at that
Labour figure over one hundred and
ninety one for Jeremy Corbyn that would
be the worst labour result in modern
times and certainly worse than the
figure obtained by Michael foot back in
1983 a low point for labour
let's look at the wider picture and here
we have the figures for all the parties
the Conservatives we are suggesting on
three hundred and sixty eight that is a
rise of fifty seats in this election as
suggested by the exit poll labour on a
hundred and ninety one suffering as many
as seventy one losses that's the
suggestion of the pole and the SNP on 55
making some twenty gains the Lib Dems on
13 up just one seat Pleiku Murray on
three losing a seat the Greens on one no
change the brexit party not winning any
seats according to this exit poll and
the others most of those in Northern
Ireland are making up nineteen it is an
exit poll we will see how accurate it is
of course when the results start coming

dramatic poll and it certainly suggests

very solid majority of at least 80 seats
possibly 86
